alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 6:09AM EST until February 24 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Oatka Creek At Garbutt affecting Monroe and Genesee Counties. Black Creek At Churchville affecting Monroe and Genesee Counties. .Rain and snowmelt led to rising levels on creeks and rivers. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Oatka Creek...including Garbutt...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black Creek...including Churchville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oatka Creek At Garbutt. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flood stage, general flooding of agricultural land begins, some basement flooding in Scottsville and Garbutt. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM EST Thursday was 6.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 4.3 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.2 feet on 09/09/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 615 PM EST.
